argo.rule_scoring.rule_scoring.rule_scoring_methods module¶

Class for scoring rules

class argo.rule_scoring.rule_scoring.rule_scoring_methods.PerformanceScorer(performance_func: object)[source]¶

Bases: object

Generates rule scores from a performance function.

fit(X_rules: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, y: pandas.core.series.Series, sample_weight=None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Generates rule scores from a weighting function.

Parameters

  • X_rules (pd.DataFrame) – The binary columns associated with the rules.

  • y (pd.Series) – The binary target column.

  • sample_weight (np.array, optional) – Row-wise sample_weights to apply. Defaults to None.

Returns

The rule scores applied to the dataset (similar to

binary columns, with the rule score replacing the 1 value).

Return type

pd.DataFrame

class argo.rule_scoring.rule_scoring.rule_scoring_methods.LogRegScorer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Generates rule scores from the exponentiated coefficients of a trained Logistic Regression model.

fit(X_rules: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, y: pandas.core.series.Series, sample_weight=None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Generates rule scores from the coefficients of a trained Logistic Regression model.

Parameters

  • X_rules (pd.DataFrame) – The binary columns associated with the rules.

  • y (pd.Series) – The binary target column.

  • sample_weight (np.array, optional) – Row-wise sample_weights to apply. Defaults to None.

Returns

The rule scores applied to the dataset (similar to

binary columns, with the rule score replacing the 1 value).

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Generates rule scores from the feature importance of a trained Random Forest model.

Generates rule scores from the feature importance of a trained Random Forest model.

Parameters

  • X_rules (pd.DataFrame) – The binary columns associated with the rules.

  • y (pd.Series) – The binary target column.

  • sample_weight (np.array, optional) – Row-wise sample_weights to apply. Defaults to None.

Returns

The rule scores applied to the dataset (similar to

binary columns, with the rule score replacing the 1 value).
